comments.body: This makes a lot of sense! The creeper hasn't really been updated in 13 years, and Mojang loves adding things like Strays, Boggeds, and Husks, so they should add this new creeper variant. Also, another ranged weapon would be cool. Also, I know they might be hesitant to add something that's called a blowgun, because Mojang doesn't like guns, but this is just a traditional weapon, and they are also called blow pipes and blow tubes.But it would be so cool. It would have a cool down like an ender pearl, and then you would be able to instantly shoot it, no cool down once it's loaded.
maybe make normal 0 ticks, exposed 1, weathered 2, and oxidized 3 but its good idea

Perfect!...But how would this effect the wolves that people have tamed already?

would the breed change?
Regardless of how this idea is implemented, weapons and tools in Minecraft need much more variation!

If this feature is added, I would probably expect a villager profession to go with it; perhaps a 'craftsman' which can modify tools at a cost of 5-7 emeralds, thus providing a way to basic tool tinkering early-game? (The tier of tools the craftsman modifies goes up with its level, perhaps.) The craftsman could also buy spare sticks and raw material to increase its level.

Also, could the making of the Tinkering Table be a bit more expensive, or even found only in structures? The tinkering table should only be available mid-game, (say, the player having full iron tools and going to the Nether) so that the default tools with balanced attributes could be used longer.
Good idea.

This is a spectacular idea! With the announcement of the confirming of the bundle being fully implemented, meaning the developing team is still hard at work on future 1.21 updates, this would fit right in! I think the community would love this feature.

I love this idea! I don't love the idea of rockets launching you straight up, but I do agree the elytra needs to be nerfed in some way.

Here's a few suggestions created by me :

1.21.D1 For Drop 1 which is plentiful bundle drops

1.21.D7 for mount of mayhem (the current one)

For Snapshot then

Year/week/drop/time (the amount of updates in that week in alphabetical order)

Like 26w25D8a for the next Game Drops Snapshot

We Don't Want the New Numbering System and we don't want to beg for it. We demand for it to be removed immediately.

The New game update numbering system is a clear admission of failure to update the game properly.

Mojang has went lazy just Like North Korea when they dropped the terms "6th Congress" when they know that there won't be a "7th Congress" like how Microsoft drop the "1.21" version knowing that there won't be a "1.22"

Without the 1.21 version we won't ever know if the game ever get updated properly or not which is results in more confusing update version numbers.

Microsoft and Mojang is and has been unable to keep its promises for its players.

We want Updates not Game Drops

We want accountability not New Numbering System

We Want Freedom not Conditions And We want it now.

I don't think this do the copper be useful, because, after all, the players are going to the Diamond and Netherite armor, and even if it has advantages or special abilities, few people want to use it. The best way (in my opinion) to improve the Copper is with items and mechanics, not armor or tools, at the end, minerals like Iron are useful even if you have full Netherite armor because it has other uses.
Don't forget copper tools!
Don't forget copper tools!

I'd love it if a copper tool/armor set replaced Iron. I suppose in the grand scheme of things both would still be out-shined by diamond and netherite, but it would still be great to have iron be closer to 800 or 900 durability and then put copper at the 250 point. It'd be a little stronger / faster than stone and would be a requirement to mine iron ore (instead of stone tools), but with how prolific copper is in the game it'd be perfect at that durability level. From a historical perspective, this progression would fit perfectly since Humans naturally went from stone/flint -> copper/bronze -> iron -> steel(diamond?).

I think Mojang could also use the oxidization effect to their advantage. Like over time the copper tools oxidize, which forms both a protective coating and further damages the tools, like the chance of the tool being damaged is less, but when it happens it is at a higher amount depending on the oxidization level; fresh copper tools would take 1 damage each use, but fully oxidized copper would take 4 damage per use but would have a lower random chance to be used. Or if they didn't want to go this route they could instead affect other aspects of the tools, like attack/tool speed decreasing each oxidized level but the harvest level would increase bringing fully oxidized tools at the same level of iron, so fresh tools can't harvest diamond/emerald/gold ore but fully oxidized can.

Essentially be a toolset between stone/gold and iron that scales up by oxidization.

Yeah I very much agree, Aether fits so well in vanilla as a counterpart to Nether, I want more bosses too and the grappling hook to traverse the Aether.

Wow... I have never seen a more well-thought-out post in my life. The detail to this idea is top notch. Maybe have occasional tnt dispensers placed all around ad well to take advantage of the water logged room.

Yes, fix wind burst and revert it back to the way it was so that it will not be a overly rare weapon that is also unideal in the regular survival combat due to it's lesser durability than a enchanted diamond sword. The only thing that makes the very rare mace better than the much easier to obtain enchanted diamond sword is the fall damage thing, which is very situational. if wind burst has to be nerfed, at least make it where it activates with regular critical hits, that way it still requires some skill to use. I personally don't think the mace needs to be nerfed in any way, due to it's rarity, but maybe it is just me. And for those complaining about how "overpowered" it is in PVP, here is some solutions, hit the opponent with snowballs, eggs, or maybe wind charges (those wind charges are usually better for traversal) or Dodge/use a ender pearl to escape. you don't need to weaken the mace, as the player will hurt himself as long as he misses, hurting himself. Just have to use a different playstyle. And most people do PVE over PVP anyway (or, you know, regular survival). Also, warden people, when are you ever going to fall that far.

I agree that how they changed it defeats the whole purpose of the enchantment, and only makes it useful in specific cases but I don‚Äôt think it should be reverted to how it was. Activating the wind burst everytime you hit something was excessive and doesn‚Äôt allow for any strategy, however if the wind burst was activated on a critical hit then it could be used strategically and still be balanced. You can still use the mace normally, but can activate the wind burst if you do it right, and not just by being high up or using a wind charge.

For the benefit of of the people who are worried about the mace, in addition to my earlier comment, I must mention another method for dealing with the mace: the potion of slow falling. the slow falling potion, which is made by brewing phantom membranes in the brewing stand, completely eliminates the smash damage for the mace. This is because the mace's damage is actually calculated using a players velocity when falling, not the distance. Therefore a potion of slow falling makes the attack not count as a smash attack. If you get them when they are falling, you can hit them with slow falling and then brutally murder them by hitting them with a punch enchanted bow (or snow balls, eggs, etc.) over and over again, nocking them higher and higher into the sky, and they can't do anything to stop it (except milk, run out of range if they try to drink it). Then the potion will wear off and as long as they can't hit a entity with their mace, they will die of fall damage and you can run in and get their stuff. Battle brutally won. Also, so this comment is on topic, please restore the wind burst enchantment to it's original form, or at least let critical hit trigger it. It is not that fun anymore, especially when you consider that wind burst books are actually rarer than the mace itself. Plus that rarity could be just a level one book and you would have to do the ominous trials again to try and get more books to get or upgrade to the level three version. Plus, finding more ominous vaults.
It's crafted with a slime block to prevent infinite slime duping, though I still think that's possible with looting.

I like the first idea with the silverfish scales, but the second one is too OP. If you could craft the oozing potion with one slimeball but then get more than one back from the effect, that's now infinite slime you got.

This change is much needed. Also some points:

1. Because this potion doesn't work on players but only mobs, they can have a different base potion for making these - for example the mundane potion. This means mundane potion can be used to brew those categories of potion which can only be used on mobs and not players. This will add a use for the mundane potion, and will also make it more intuitive.

2. People have been putting concerns that changing the brewing recipe from slime block to slime ball will make it too OP. Well it already is OP. You can make one splash potion of oozing, drop it on a lot of chicken on the same place and kill them. Each chicken will drop around 2 slimes upon death, which with looting will give you tons of slimes. Once you make a chicken farm, it will effectively also become the least effort and best return slime farm in the game.

3. The way it can be fixed is by giving the slimes spawned using oozing potion a tag that they will not give any drops - the same way Zombies that are converted into Drowneds do not drop Tridents or Nautilus Shells.
